list_definition.definition: to make (a boat or ship) slide into the water or (a rocket) leave the ground

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: As soon as the alarm was sounded, the lifeboat was launched
The Russians have launched a rocket.

list_definition.definition: to start (a person, project etc) off on a course

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His success on a TV talent show launched him on a brilliant career.
The protesters launched bricks and other missiles at the police.
The rocket launch is scheduled for this afternoon.

list_definition.definition: a large, power-driven boat, usually used for short trips or for pleasure

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We cruised round the bay in a motor launch.
